授業目的: The purpose of this class is for students to obtain basic knowledge for understanding US economy by using micro and macro economic theories.
到達目標: Students will be able to understand the follwoings: (1) how US economy had grown from the early 19th century, (2) how banking and finance systems and policies work or not work, and (3) how US corporate governance is different from Japan, and (4)wheter or not competition policy promotes economic efficiency.
特記事項: 【合併】US Economy（国際学部）/US Economy（経済学部）
関連科目:
This is an English version of America Keizai Ron (アメリカ経済論）.
Students can register either English version or Japanese Version. If you wish to take both versions, please refer to the Study Information and follow the prescribed procedures.
授業の概要・背景: Becuase US economy is still significant and infuluential in the world economy, citizens of any nations should understand how the US economy functions.
授業方法: Because this class is held in English, by SIS rule, it is face-to-face format from the first lecture.

第2回: US Economic History until the end of the 19th century
第3回: Great Depression and New Deal Policy On Demand Lecture
第4回: Keynesian and Anti-Keynesian Macro Economic Policy
第5回: Review  and prepare for the first exam.
第7回: Market Mechanism (Perfect competition) and Market Failures
第8回: Competition Policy: Regulation on Monopoly, Merger, and Cartel
第9回: Competition Policy: Regulation on Inter-firm Relationship
第13回: Student Presentation.  Submit printed power point slides.
トピック.授業計画1: All lectures are held in face to face format.
トピック.授業外学習2: Students should read assigned  chapters of the textbook. Recommended time for study is indicated in the parenthesis. Students are also required to prepare the presentation and mini-report.
